intro: Calodonta, commonly known as the ghost orchid, is a rare and elusive flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, white, spider-like flowers. The plant has a unique symbiotic relationship with a specific type of fungus, which provides it with essential nutrients. Calodonta lacks true leaves and instead relies on its roots for photosynthesis. Due to its rarity and habitat specificity, it is considered an endangered species.
